util.text

Class NamesTextCouplingUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.text.NamesTextCouplingUtil

  • public class NamesTextCouplingUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class can either take a file of names and a file of associated text and generate a DataSet of both, or de-couple an existing DataSet that has names as its first attribute and text as its second into two files, one corresponding to names, the other to text.

    • Constructor Summary

      NamesTextCouplingUtil()

      Combines a file of names/titles and a file of associated text into a single DataSet and persists it to a new ARFF file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static void splitFile(java.io.File originalFile, java.io.File nameFile, java.io.File textFile)
      Takes the original file that has names as its first attribute, like text titles - and text as its second - and breaks it up into two files.

      • splitFile

        public static void splitFile(java.io.File originalFile,
             java.io.File nameFile,
             java.io.File textFile)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Takes the original file that has names as its first attribute, like text titles - and text as its second - and breaks it up into two files.
        Parameters:
        originalFile - ARFF file that has names as its first attribute, like text titles - and text as its second.
        nameFile - ARFF file of names/titles.
        textFile - ARFF file of textual content.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • join

        public static void join(java.io.File nameFile,
        java.io.File textFile,
        java.io.File newFile)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Combines a file of names/titles and a file of associated text into a single DataSet and persists it to a new ARFF file.
        Parameters:
        nameFile - File of names/titles - each in a new line.
        textFile - File of textual content - each in a new line.
        newFile - ARFF file that has names as its first attribute, like text titles - and text as its second.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
